newsitem.title: Treats from the Edwardian Country House
newsitem.newstext: James and Hugh the presenter discuss how the Edwardians kept honeybees and how they used the by-products they harvested from their bees. Shot on location at James's orchard/apiary, 'Bee Heaven Farm' in Surrey surrounded by 180 rare apple trees and 40 beehives on site. Don't miss it!

newstext.para: A course run by The Hive Honey Shop for beginners who have little or no previous knowledge of bees or beekeeping.

newsitem.title: Welcome to a Bellyful of Barden...

newstext.para: Nigel Barden, food critic for BBC Radio London, gives some tips on Honey in London.

"Attention all drones, there are thousands of bee hives secreted round London. For a selection of magnificent honeys and all things concerned with apiary (the keeping of bees), fly to The Hive Honey Shop"
"Here you will be able to find out where and how to buy the best produce, meet the personalities on the page and learn why their food is so special."
